description: Alteration to front/side boundary, front/rear garden paving/landscaping; replacement windows and doors to rear elevation with altered opening size
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):  FDC/22/05/06a Existing elevations, FDC/22/05/10b Proposed right-side elevation, FDC/22/05/01 Site location plan , FDC/22/05/12a Proposed rear elevation, FDC/22/05/02a Block plan, FDC/22/05/04a Existing roof plans, FDC/22/05/03a Existing floor plans, FDC/22/05/05a Existing elevations , FDC/22/05/07b Proposed ground floor plan, FDC/22/05/11b Proposed left-side elevation, FDC/22/05/09b Proposed front elevation.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Notwithstanding any information submitted, prior to the occupation of the development full details of hard and soft landscaping works and boundary treatments; and a landscaping management plan covering 5 years from the implementation of final planting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

The approved works shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, to ensure appropriately landscaped amenity space and public realm, in accordance with policies D3, D4 and D8 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the approved plans, further details of the hard and soft landscaping shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. All detailed works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of the premises. Such details shall include: the height and materials of the boundary treatment, the provision of planting in the forecourt and any new surfacing materials to be used.

Reason:  To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening in accordance with policies 5.10 and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D8, G4 and G5 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
